page.title: 01General View of Our Area
page.content: Haverfordwest, with all the roads leading to it, is the centre of Pembrokeshire, as it is so well placed. Roads come in from Fishguard, Milford Haven, Pembroke, Cardigan, Carmarthen and St.David's. The only parts of Haverfordwest coming into our project area include:_ {** Prendergast ** This place used to be a separate village. There is a main A-road which passes through to Fishguard, having a B-road forking off it to Cardigan. Farms at{** Pelcomb **}& else-where are quite small (with old buildings) having just little more than country lanes joining them to other farms & very small hamlets. Passing through Pelcomb is an A-road to St.David's. {** Hamlet of St.Martin ** (area as far north as Pelcomb Bridge) possesses its OWN Community Council.
